in_favor: Billions in economic losses remain stubbornly high despite efforts to reduce disaster impacts.
Disaster-related economic losses in LDCs are over six times the global average.
Government spending on essential services – encompassing education, health and social protection – averages around 50% of total government expenditure.
against: Despite significant efforts to reduce disaster impacts, related economic losses remain stubbornly high.
Disaster-related economic losses in LDCs are four times the global average, while accounting for only 1.1% of reporting countries' combined GDP.
Government spending on essential services – encompassing education, health and social protection – averages around 50% of total government expenditure.
